facts.1: Tanabata, also known as the Star Festival, originates from the Chinese Qixi Festival.
facts.2: It celebrates the meeting of the deities Orihime and Hikoboshi (represented by the stars Vega and Altair).
facts.3: People in Japan celebrate by writing wishes on tanzaku papers and hanging them on bamboo trees.

facts.1: World Chocolate Day is sometimes said to commemorate the introduction of chocolate to Europe in 1550.
facts.2: On this day, chocolate lovers around the world indulge in their favorite chocolate treats.
facts.3: The day is also used to promote fair trade chocolate and to highlight the labor of cocoa farmers.

facts.1: Ivan Kupala Day is a traditional Slavic holiday that originally celebrated the summer solstice.
facts.2: The festivities include jumping over bonfires, singing, and dancing as a means of purification.
facts.3: It is often associated with the search for the fern flower, which is said to bring luck to anyone who finds it.
